page.title: 02LOCAL GOVERNMENT IN HARWICH
page.content: THE HARWICH TOWN COUNCIL WAS SET UP IN 1974 TO REPLACE THE OLD BOROUGH COUNCIL. THERE ARE NOW SIXTEEN COUNCILLORS WHO MEET AT THE GUILDHALL EVERY THREE WEEKS. THE COUNCIL IS SIMILAR TO A PARISH COUNCIL, RUNNING ALLOTMENTS, LOOKING AT TOWN PLANNING APPLICATIONS AND GRANTING MONEY TO DIFFERENT ORGANIZATIONS. TO PAY THIS, THE TENDRING DISTRICT COUNCIL COLLECTS RATES FROM EVERY HOUSEHOLDER. THE LOCAL COUNCIL RECEIVES Â£8000 FROM THE RATES.TO HELP LOCAL PEOPLE THEY PAID FOR A HOIST FOR THE NEW SWIMMING POOL. THE COUNCIL EMPLOY 2 PEOPLE - A CLERK AND ALSO A CARETAKER TO LOOK AFTER THE GUILDHALL. THE COUNCIL ALSO TRIES TO KEEP ALIVE OLD TRADITIONS. A NEW MAYOR IS CHOSEN ANNUALLY AND A MAYOR MAKING CEREMONY IS HELD EVERY YEAR, IN MAY, TO START THE MAYOR'S TERM OF OFFICE.
